English: Gosh Durnit! My basement flooded again!
column6: Gosh Durnit! My basement flooded again!

English: I think I have a bucket 'round here somewhere...
column6: I think I have a bucket 'round here somewhere...

English: Your bucket is over on the shelf. Click on it to add it to your toolbox.
column7: The diuretic is over on the shelf. Click on it to add it to your inventory.

English: Not again!
It's a door to the outside.

Maybe there's something at Doc's hardware store that can help.
Click on the door to the right to leave your basement.

column7: Looks like the patient will need more than a diuretic

English: That's a lot of water!
Click the door to leave your basement.
Finally! We got that dang water outta my dang basement!
I sure hope that never happens again!
Two weeks later...
Congratulations! The water level has decreased. However, it is not enough...
This is too hard!

English: I'd better head back to the hardware store.
Phew!
Are you kidding me?!
That's it.
I'm done.
I ain't puttin up with this dang basement any longer!

It's that rusty washer.
I'd better put the new washer on.
Whoops, forgot to tighten the washer!
This pump is busted!
The valve is leaking, it looks like there's a rusty washer.
I don't have the tools to replace it, I need to go to Doc's.
The valve is leaking, it looks like there's a rusty washer.
I don't have the tools to replace it, I need to go to Doc's.
I'm pooped! I need some extra muscle.
I bet my friend Tony could help out, I should give him a call.
You've chosen the correct parts for the pump and the water level has decreased.
column7: By using the Large Handle, you have increased the stroke volume of the pump (heart)

English: Still not enough... I could use some extra hands.
column7: One of the ways to improve heart failure is to recruit more muscle with medication or other methods

English: This isn't any better. I should try different parts.
column7: Physiologically speaking, what else can you do to improve heart function?

New washer placed on pump.
Here goes nothing!
The recruited muscle has helped bring the water level down.
column7: Having your friends help in the basement is medically like recruitment of more heart muscle (improving pumping efficiency)

English: Phew... I'm wiped out. Got any grub?
Gee Tony, I haven't got any food
Why don't you give that pizza place a call?

Bucket added to your toolbox.
There it is! Now I can scoop up some of this water.
Click on the bucket icon in your toolbox at the bottom left to select it.
You also have a cell phone, which you can use to call the Hint Hotline.
There's my bucket! I can use that to scoop out the water.
column7: Medically, consider the bucket to be a Diuretic (It helps the kidneys get rid of excess fluid)

Just what I needed!
It's beautiful!
Like a charm!

Hello valued customer, what can I do for you?
column6: Hello valued customer, what can I do for you?

English: My basement's flooded. Got anything to help with that?
column6: My basement's flooded. Got anything to help with that'

English: We've got a special Pumps 4 Chumps promotion going on!
column6: We've got a special Pumps 4 Chumps promotion going on! It'll be sure to unflood your flood, no money back guarantee!

English: It'll be sure to unflood your flood, no money back guarantee!
I hate everything you just said, but I guess I'll take it.
column6: I hate everything you just said, but I guess I'll take it.

English: Pump added to you toolbox.
Cut the crap, carpetbagger!
column6: Cut the crap, carpetbagger! That pump didn't do squat!

English: That pump didn't do squat!
I'm so sorry to hear that!
column6: I'm so sorry to hear that! I recommend upgrading to a higher end model handle and hose. We're running a 25% off special on all pump accessories!

English: I recommend upgrading to a higher end model handle and hose.
We're running a 25% off special on all pump accessories!
Hey Doc, that bilge pump ain't cuttin it no more.
Got anything better?
I'm afraid not.
You'll have to call PumpCo to get anything better than that bilge pump.
Hey Doc, that bilge pump's busted.
The valve is leaking because of a rusted washer.
I've got just what you need: Doc's bilge pump repair kit!
This repair kit has everything you need to replace that rusted washer.
And you're in luck, I happen to have one left in stock!
They're very popular, you know, this won't last long.
Alright alright Doc, I'll take it
Repair Kit added to your toolbox.
I'll take a medium handle.
Medium Handle added to your toolbox.
An excellent choice sir! Anything else?
column6: An excellent choice sir! Anything else?

English: I'll take a large handle.
column7: Good choice, this is physiologically equivalent to improving stroke volume

English: Large Handle added to  your toolbox.
column7: A larger (longer) handle on the pump is an increase in stroke volume, cardiac output = stroke volume x heart rate

English: An excellent choice sir! Anything else?
column6: An excellent choice sir! Anything else?

English: I'll take a medium diameter hose.
column7: The diameter of the hose is equated to "afterload". That is the resistance against which the heart is pumping

English: Medium Hose added to  your toolbox.
An excellent choice sir! Anything else?
column6: An excellent choice sir! Anything else?

English: I'll take a large diameter hose.
column7: Excellent choice, this is equivlent physiologically to AFTERLOAD REDUCTION

English: Large Hose added to  your toolbox.
column7: A larger diameter hose is a decrease in afterload (it decreases the work the heart must do to pump blood)

English: An excellent choice sir! Anything else?
column6: An excellent choice sir! Anything else?

English: Do you have any larger options?
Nope.
Can you check the back?
Alright, alright, you got me. These are the biggest handles and hoses we have in stock.
Hey Tony. My basement is flooded, I've got this pump but I need more muscle!
Again?! Alright, I'll be right over
column7: This would be like increasing the dose of the diuretic

English: Ay Dave, I'm here to he-
Oh boy.
The bucket is located on the shelf above the laundry machine. Click on it to add it to your toolbox.
Your toolbox is located at the bottom left. Move the mouse down to the lower left, and the toolbox will slide up. Then, click on the bucket icon to select it.
With the bucket selected, use it on the water by clicking anywhere on the water.
To move around the room, click the spot you would like to walk to.
Now the fun begins!
Try scooping up some of the water with a bucket.
Now that you have a pump, you can select it from your toolbox and use it on the water in your basement.
You should go back home. Walk all the way to the left and click on the door.
Now that you've placed the pump, time to try it out! Click on the pump to give it a go.
I hear Doc over at the hardware store is running a big sale on pumps. I bet one of those would help you.
You can leave your basement by clicking on the door, located all the way to the right. If you cannot see it, keep walking to the right.
You should go back to Doc at his hardware store. Maybe he has something else that could help.
You could use some extra muscle. Try calling a friend, maybe they could help out.
Tony is tired, he needs something to boost his energy. That pizza place delivers, try giving them a call.
Thank for for calling the Hint Hotline. Our lines our busy at the moment, please call back later.
Hi, I'd like to order a large cheese and pepporini pizza for delivery

That was fast.

Yes it is!
It's a beautiful hilltop property with a stunning view of the entire island, and-

Never has, no.
I'll take it!
Really? Don't you want to see it first? I can give a tour today.
Nope that's quite alright, I'm in, where do I sign?
Great! This is the easiest sale I've ever had!
The house will be ready for you in three months.
THREE MONTHS?!
I'm standing here in a water up to my neck, and no matter what I do, it keeps coming back!
What am I supposed to do for three months?!
Well Dave, since you have been such a wonderful client...
How about I set you up with an electric pump rental?
Free of charge!
Well alrighty then, but it better be quick!
